results.title: Port of London
results.creator_credit: Greenpark Productions, Port of London Authority, Humphrey Swingler, G. Buckland-Smith and Clifford Hornby
results.brief_description: The work of the Port of London Authority, which administers the tidal waters of the Thames. Shows the handling of cargoes on the docks and the storage, sampling, and grading of a wide variety of goods, also the piloting of vessels on the river.

results.title: Pork: the meal with a squeal
results.brief_description: This work focuses on the world distribution of pigs. Also covers the breeds of pigs, farming pigs, different sections for different meats, and meatless by-products such as brush bristle, insulin, cortisone, and thyroid extract.
results.description: This work focuses on the world distribution of pigs. Also covers the breeds of pigs, farming pigs, different sections for different meats, and meatless by-products such as brush bristle, insulin, cortisone, and thyroid extract.

results.title: Pork on the farm: killing, curing and canning
results.brief_description: Details the best methods for raising pigs for home use (as distinct from marketing them) are given; correct slaughtering methods are shown; the general principles which give nest results in cutting up pork are demonstrated; and detailed descriptions of carious ways of curing pork.

results.title: Porcupine quill work
results.brief_description: Discusses the use of porcupine quills for decorative purposes. Also explains the historical significance of its use among the Indians, which pre-dates the arrival of Europeans to North America.
results.description: Discusses the use of porcupine quills for decorative purposes. Also explains the historical significance of its use among the Indians, which pre-dates the arrival of Europeans to North America.

results.title: Pop movie. Part 2
results.brief_description: Fremont High School in Elizabeth Park South Australia is a school that is becoming famous for its musical productions. A group of students who are involved in the production of a Rock Musical from casting to preparation of a backdrop which depicts the area in which they live show the fun and sharing that occurs during rehearsals for the show “Type Cast”. Students commence on the breaking down of class level barriers that normally exist in schools, on the ease of communicating with teachers as they learn about devising and producing a pop musical. Positive attitudes are fostered, about self and ability and all regard the experience as “great”!

results.title: Pop movie. Part 1
results.brief_description: A six part series offering an in-depth view of the rock music industry. To those who are fans or aspire to a career in music it is compulsory viewing; and for a more general audience it is an insight into the chaotic world of rock `n’ roll.
